{{alias}}( n )
    Computes the least common multiple (LCM) of all integers from 1 up to `n`.

    If `n` is less than or equal to 0, the function returns `0`.

    The input `n` must be an integer; otherwise, the function returns `NaN`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    n: integer
        Upper bound integer for the range (1 to `n`).

    Returns
    -------
    out: integer
        Least common multiple of all integers from 1 to `n`.

    Examples
    --------
    > var v = {{alias}}( 10 )
    2520

    See Also
    --------
    - `@stdlib/math/base/special/gcd`: compute the greatest common divisor (gcd).
